stomach.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the organ inside your body where food begins to be digested
stomach.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I was so hungry my stomach hurt.
His stomach was full of food.
stomach.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the front part of your body, below your chest
stomach.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He turned round and punched Carlos in the stomach.
stomach.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: A lot of these children don't know what it is like to have a full stomach.
It was 11 o'clock, and my stomach was empty.
Debbie was at home because she had an upset stomach.
I had terrible stomach ache last night.
He complained of acute stomach pains.
He's off work with a stomach bug.
The boy had a stomach upset after eating berries from the garden.
Too much stress can cause stomach ulcers.
She was diagnosed with stomach cancer last year.
Her stomach was churning with anxiety.
Her stomach lurched at the thought of leaving Millfield.
The doctor gave me some tablets to settle my stomach.
stomach.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to be able to accept something, especially something unpleasant
stomach.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: A 26% water rate increase is more than most residents can stomach.
Rob found Cathy’s attitude hard to stomach.
stomach.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to eat something without becoming ill
stomach.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: I’ve never been able to stomach seafood.
